thread.title: Patriots: Bill Belichick praises play of special teams
thread.title_full: Patriots: Bill Belichick praises play of special teams

author: Rich Garven Telegram & Gazette Staff
title: Patriots: Bill Belichick praises play of special teams
text: Patriots: Bill Belichick praises play of special teams Comment Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 4:56 PM Updated at 12:19 AM Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 4:56 PM Updated at 12:19 AM The defense dominated throughout and the offense was ultimately efficient as the Patriots improved to 4-0 with a 24-point victory over the Dallas Cowboys on Sunday. The third, and often overlooked, phase of football was equally impressive for the Belichickans. That would be special teams, which was superb in every aspect. “Well, first of all I thought that we got real good play from our specialists in the game, which is always a key for good special teams play,” coach Bill Belichick said Tuesday in a conference call. “Our kickers, our snapper, holder, returners, all of the guys that are there that had a key role in the ball handling on those plays.” Kicker Stephen Gostkowski remained, like the Patriots, perfect on the season. He teamed with holder Ryan Allen and rookie long snapper Joe Cardona to make all six of his kicks: three extra points from 33 yards and field goals from 34, 49 and 57 yards, the latter tying the franchise record set by Adam Vinatieri in 2002. Gostkowski also had six touchbacks on seven kickoffs, giving him 24 on the season. That total ranks second in the NFL. Allen kept a low profile the past two games, punting just once. He was called on four times Sunday and came up big each time. The third-year pro from Louisiana Tech excelled situationally, placing three balls at the Dallas 13-yard line and one at the 20. Those kicks played a prominent part in the Cowboys starting their 12 drives on average at their 18, which all but doomed the Tony Romo-less offense to defeat. Danny Amendola averaged 13 yards on four punt returns. Amendola, who took over as the primary punt returner this season to ease the workload on Pro Bowl receiver Julian Edelman, is tied for eighth in the league with an average of 11 yards. Amendola got a great-double team block from Logan Ryan and Patrick Chung to spring him for a 25-yard return early in the first quarter, setting up a field goal that gave the Patriots a 3-0 lead. “We did a real good job with our corners on the gunners on the punt team in order to get the return started and Danny did a good job of running, so it was really a good group effort all around,” Belichick said. Conversely, the Patriots held the Cowboys to 21 yards on one kick return and an average of 3 yards on two punt returns. “The coverage was a combination of good kicking and good coverage and (our) returning yardage I’d say was a combination of some good holdups and good running,” Belichick said. “A little bit of everything there.” While the Patriots had to cover four punts Sunday their season total stands at a paltry nine. Allen has punted so few times he doesn’t qualify to be listed among the league leaders. And because of Gostkowski’s big leg, the Patriots have only had to cover seven kickoffs this season. Conversely, they have yet to have a legitimate kick return this season. Their only return came on a squib kick that monstrous tight end Michael Williams lugged back 8 yards. With a lack of game reps, practice takes on added importance for the kick return and two coverage units, which include core special teamers Brandon Bolden, Nate Ebner, Jonathan Freeny, Jordan Richards, and captain Matthew Slater. “Obviously, games are different than practices,” Ebner said. “But we work it as hard as we can in practice to prepare ourselves for the game and whatever comes up in the game we just have to be ready to take it on as it comes. Like I said, each week is different and we try to build from week to week and try to get as many reps as we can to be ready for it when it comes up.” Belichick pointed out there are plenty of things that don’t come up every week, including goal-line defense and 2-minute drives. But at some point they will. “You just keep preparing for them, and when it happens, you have to be ready to go,” said Belichick, who was a special teams assistant with the Detroit Lions in 1976. The Patriots were ready to go Sunday and departed Dallas with another big win, special teams contributing to the outcome as much as a stifling defense and a slow-starting offense. —Contact Rich Garven at rgarven@telegram.com. Follow him on Twitter @RichGarvenTG. JOB CODE 233. polarbev.com EOE Polar Beverages is a drug free workplace [+] DIRECTOR OF COMMUNITY AND MEDIA RELATIONS Under the DIRECTOR OF COMMUNITY AND MEDIA RELATIONS Under the supervision of the Chief Marketing Officer, the Director of Media and Community Relations, develops, coordinates, and executes strategic media and community relations initiatives for a variety of news media-traditional, nontraditional, and emerging-as well as for social media, web, and other electronic publications. This position is responsible for proactively promoting a consistent, positive, and unified image of the College that serves to enhance and broaden awareness for the College, its people, and its achievements; establishes and strengthens local, regional, national, and global exposure for the College; and supports the College's mission and strategic initiatives. QUALIFICATIONS A bachelor's degree in journalism, communications, and/or a related field, and five years of demonstrated experience with all elements of communications (web/social media, press, publications, external relations, events), with cutting-edge experience in at least one required. Demonstrated experience serving as an institutional spokesperson; experience and/or knowledge working in community relations in an educational, corporate, or business environment; and, experience as a media representative for higher education institutions and familiarity with sensitive college issues is a plus. Demonstrated experience placing stories in local, regional, and national media; a strategic thinker who excels at advancing original ideas and has the ability to execute; experience working with higher education industry analysts to facilitate briefings and educational events and with external relations, cultivating stakeholders, partners, and audiences (including development and management of various lists); experience using appropriate tools and metrics to measure the effectiveness of media and Community Relations initiatives; exceptional writing, editing, and proofreading skills, with a proven track record of meeting tight deadlines while maintaining high quality; attention to detail and mastery of the rules of grammar; familiarity with both the Associated Press and Chicago Manual styles; exceptional communications skills (both verbal and written); strong attention to detail, good aesthetic judgment, and a passion for fact-checking, researching, and organizing information; the ability to represent the College in public venues; highly organized, dependable, enthusiastic, intuitive, and creative; capable of working well under pressure, adapting easily to changing circumstances in a fast-paced environment, and utilizing a creative approach to problem solving; ability to manage multiple demands and projects simultaneously and to work with minimum supervision as well as part of a team; and, knowledge and/or experience in photography and videography. The priority application deadline for this position is Wednesday October 7, 2015. The position remains open until filled. Send cover letter, resume, and three professional references to DirectorCMR@becker.edu Becker College has a strong commitment to diversity and encourages applications from a broad spectrum of people, including women, persons of color, persons with disabilities, and veterans to apply. Becker College is an Equal Opportunity Employer. [+] LOAN SERVICING POSITIONS Loan Administration LOAN SERVICING POSITIONS Loan Administration Officer/AVP Putnam Bank, having branch locations throughout Eastern Connecticut, is seeking an enthusiastic team player to fill the position of the Loan Administration Officer. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of five years' experience in loan servicing. Responsibilities include managing loan servicing for mortgage, consumer and commercial loans and ensuring accurate loan booking, documentation, and payment processing. The qualified candidate will have experience in servicing for the secondary market, escrow analysis, private mortgage insurance and regulatory compliance. Loan Servicing Specialist Putnam Bank has an immediate full time Loan Servicing Specialist position available in our Lending Department. This position functions as the primary source for the timely servicing of all loans within the organization to include: the processing of loans, lines of credit, tax payments and loan payoffs. Ensures that documentation and practices are in full compliance with all regulatory guidelines. The individual will be detail oriented, experienced in Microsoft Office and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. We offer an excellent salary and benefit package. Please submit resume & salary requirements to: Putnam Bank 40 Main Street Putnam, CT 06260 Attention: Human Resources Department 0r Email to belliott@putnambank.com EOE/AA
